1121.content:
Howard scurried home quickly from school. His mother Chara had told him to get right home because their neighbor asked for his help. She had volunteered him without consulting him, but one thing Howard knew - you didn't want to cross his mother. You got one warning before you were up over her lap, tail in the air, and well, you didn't sit comfortably for a while. No sir, Howard didn't want to be late.

He went straight over to the neighbor's house. Mrs. Eekhoorn was a nice lady and he didn't really mind helping her out. The Eekhoorns moved in a few years ago so they could send their girls to Hollow Oaks, one of the best schools in the forest. Janet was a year or two older than Howard and a junior at Hollow Oaks. Becky was younger and went to Wavering Pine middle school.

He knocked on the Eekhoorn's door. Mrs. Eekhoorn answered the door. "Hello Howard, thanks for coming by. I've got a whole kitchenful of cookies I need to take over to a meeting. Can you help me?" She was dressed in her Squirrel Scout leader's uniform, a smart looking green dress. Becky stuck her head around the door. "Hi Howard!" she said. Becky was in the scouts and she was in her uniform too. Howard looked at her in her white blouse and dark green skirt with a cutout just below the waistband for her tail to stick out. Howard often wondered why boys in the forest only wore a shirt if they wore anything at all and the girls always wore clothes...

"Uhh, it's no problem Mrs Eekhoorn. What can I do to help?" You enter the house and follow them into the kitchen. There are trays and boxes of cookies everywhere.

"Janet and I were up all night baking Squirrel Scout cookies and we need to take these to the school. Becky's troop is selling them to raise money. I just need to help Becky find her sash and we'll be ready to go. Okay?"

"Sure, no problem" said Howard. The two of them left. Howard was standing alone in a room with hundreds of cookies! Surely they wouldn't miss just one? He took an oatmeal cookie from a nearby tray. He was hungry from being at school all day and the cookie was gone in two bites. Then a second. Then a third and a fourth... In just a minute, the tray was half empty!

When he realized he had eaten half a tray of cookies, he quickly tried to rearrange them to make it look like there weren't any missing. As he fumbled with the tray, he realized there was someone standing behind him tapping their paw on the floor. It was Janet and she didn't look happy.

"What do you think you're doing?" she asked. "Did you just eat all those cookies?"

"Mmmphno" you say, trying not to spray crumbs.

"Then why are your cheek pouches full? Why are there crumbs all over your fur?" she demanded.

"I'm sorry Janet. Your mother and Becky went off to look for something, and I, well, I... I'm so sorry."

"We were up all night baking those cookies to raise money, not to feed you. I'm going to go tell my mother."

"No, please don't! She'll tell my mother and well..." Howard said.

Janet looked at him quietly for a moment. Becky came back into the room wearing her sash and brushing her fur. Janet had an idea. "Okay Howard, I'll cover for you this time because I know your mother would give you the strap for this, so I'll make you a deal. I have some extra cookies I can replace these with and no one except Becky and I will know. My mother will be out tomorrow afternoon and you come straight over after school and we'll deal with this ourselves. Okay Howard? A spanking from me can't be as bad as one from your mother. Is it a deal?"

Becky looked at the decimated tray of cookies. "Hey, those cookies were for my troop!"

Janet laughed. "Yes Becky, they were. Okay. Howard, here are your choices."
1121.title: Begin
